ai-kv16.3:1.3_0: they cause another to suffer through pain.
ai-kv16.3:1.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv16.3:1.8_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv16.3:1.11_0: Their good for others’ happiness is the equivalent to others. Then they feel bliss.
ai-kv16.3:1.12_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv16.3:1.13_0: Delights to others, their own bodies don’t happiness.
ai-kv16.3:1.15_0: If you’re killed, those who don’t proceed having turned away from others, you can’t do so.
ai-kv16.3:1.16_0: “The one who gives pleasure to another,”
ai-kv16.3:2.3_0: one person does the deed and another experiences pain.
ai-kv16.3:2.4_0: And you don’t keep on doing it.
ai-kv16.3:3.2_0: “The one who gives pleasure to another,”
ai-kv16.3:3.4_0: Venerable Udāyī said to Venerable Udāyī:
ai-kv16.3:3.5_0: “The Buddha has rid us of so many unskillful things and gifted us so many skillful things! We’ve got rid of all unskillful things and gifted us so many skillful things!”
ai-kv16.3:3.8_0: for they feel bliss with him.
ai-kv16.3:3.9_0: The account of the recollection of the deities is finished.
